First, the code structure:

#include <stdio.h>

#include <string.h>

#include <ctype.h>

// Functions for checking letters and punctuation.

int isLatinLetter(char c) {

    return (c >= 'a' && c <= 'z');

}

int isPunctuation(char c) {

    return (c == '.' || c == ',' || c == '!' || c == '?');

}

int main() {

    // Read input.

    char input_str[1024]; // assuming input is not too long.

    fgets(input_str, sizeof(input_str), stdin);

    // Remove newline character if present.

    size_t len = strlen(input_str);

    if (len > 0 && input_str[len-1] == '\n') {

        input_str[len-1] = '\0';

        len--;

    }

    // Now process the input_str into result_str.

    if (len == 0) {

        // Edge case: empty input. The second program would split into zero tokens, so count 0?

        // According to the second Java program's code, if input is empty, split would be empty array, so result is 0.

        printf("0\n");

        return 0;

    }

    // Compute the required length for the result_str.

    int result_length = 1; // first character is always added.

    for (int i = 1; i < len; i++) {

        char c = input_str[i];

        if (isLatinLetter(c)) {

            char prev = input_str[i-1];

            if (!isLatinLetter(prev)) {

                result_length +=1; // space

            }

            result_length +=1; // the letter

        } else if (isPunctuation(c)) {

            result_length +=1; // punctuation

        }

        // else: do nothing.

    }

    // Allocate the result_str.

    char *result_str = malloc(result_length +1);

    if (!result_str) {

        // handle error, but for code submission, assume it works.

    }

    // Fill the result_str.

    int current_pos =0;

    // Add first character.

    result_str[current_pos++] = input_str[0];

    for (int i =1; i < len; i++) {

        char c = input_str[i];

        if (isLatinLetter(c)) {

            char prev = input_str[i-1];

            if (!isLatinLetter(prev)) {

                result_str[current_pos++] = ' ';

            }

            result_str[current_pos++] = c;

        } else if (isPunctuation(c)) {

            result_str[current_pos++] = c;

        }

    }

    result_str[current_pos] = '\0';

    // Now process the result_str through the second part.

    int count =0;

    char *token = strtok(result_str, " ");

    while (token != NULL) {

        count++;

        if (strcmp(token, "0") ==0) {

            break;

        }

        token = strtok(NULL, " ");

    }

    printf("%d\n", count);

    free(result_str);

    return 0;

}
